channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Measuring Corporate Impact: The Gold Is in the Details
item.description: Do the products and services of the companies you invest in create negative or positive material outcomes?

item.title: Chipotle CEO says ‘generous portions’ will become standard after people blasted its skimpy serving sizes on social media
item.description: Brian Niccol said roughly 10% of Chipotle’s restaurants are outliers in terms of portion sizes.

item.title: Is Widespread Crypto Adoption Inevitable?
item.description: New technologies always face resistance, but demographic shifts imply there is a fierce tailwind behind crypto adoption, politically, economically, and financially.

item.title: The ultra-rich are scooping up mansions while almost no one else can afford a typical home
item.description: Luxury-home prices rose more than twice as fast as non-luxury homes, and still their sales jumped compared to typical homes, according to Redfin.

item.title: Book Review: Shocks, Crises, and False Alarms
item.description: Carlsson-Szlezak and Swartz attempt to add fresh thinking on framing macro shocks that may often prove to be false alarms. Any general reader will obtain some key fresh insights with this work, and CFA charterholders will be offered an alternative to the conventional Wall Street approach to macro discussions.

item.title: The 10 best prepaid debit cards you can get without a credit score
item.description: No checking account? No problem. These prepaid debit cards let you add funds and swipe to pay without a ton of fees.

item.title: Preserving the Dollar: The Role of CBDCs in Securing Economic Stability for Future Generations
item.description: As financial systems evolve, preserving the US dollar's dominance will require skillful policy management and the integration of cutting-edge technologies.

item.title: Biles, Osaka, Richardson Olympic comebacks highlight issues facing people like them: ‘We’re still asking a lot of Black women athletes’
item.description: They've all bounced back to the world's biggest stage while displaying different levels of vulnerability.

item.title: Can Equal Weight Solve Our Concentration Crisis? Not So Fast…
item.description: Mega-cap concentration has exploded since 2015. The corollary to an increasingly top-heavy benchmark is that market diversification and breadth have never been more limited. A multifactor methodology can be a restorative balance to US equities when more traditional measures fall short.
